info.description:
The Data Science Platform's source-of-truth service.
Note: this API will try to load and return associations in responses, so clients won't need to make as many requests. This behavior isn't recursive, though, so associations of associations are *not* fully loaded (even if it might seem that way from looking at the data types).
info.title: Sherlock

get.description: List existing AppVersion entries, ordered by most recently updated.

parameters.description: Required when creating
parameters.name: appVersion

parameters.description: Required when creating
parameters.name: chart

parameters.description: Generally the Git commit message
parameters.name: description

parameters.description: An optional limit to the number of entries returned
parameters.name: limit

post.description:
Create a new AppVersion entry. Note that fields are immutable after creation.
If the new entry is a duplicate of one already in the database, the database will not be altered and the call will return normally but with a 200 code.

parameters.description: The AppVersion to create
parameters.name: app-version

get.description: Get an existing AppVersion entry via one its "selectors": chart/version or numeric ID.

parameters.description: The AppVersion to get's selector: chart/version or numeric ID
parameters.name: selector

patch.description: Edit an existing AppVersion entry via one its "selectors": chart/version or numeric ID. Note that only mutable fields are available here, immutable fields can only be set using /create.

parameters.description: The AppVersion to edit's selector: chart/version or numeric ID
parameters.name: selector

parameters.description: The edits to make to the AppVersion
parameters.name: app-version

get.description: List existing Changeset entries, ordered by most recently updated.

parameters.description: An optional limit to the number of entries returned
parameters.name: limit

post.description:
Create a new Changeset entry. Note that fields are immutable after creation.
You'll likely want to use the plan endpoint instead, which conditionally creates a Changeset based on there actually being a version diff.

parameters.description: The Changeset to create
parameters.name: changeset

get.description: Get an existing Changeset entry via its "selector"--its numeric ID.

parameters.description: The Changeset to get's selector--numeric ID
parameters.name: selector

parameters.description: When creating, will use the chart's default if left empty

get.description: List existing Environment entries, ordered by most recently updated.

parameters.description: Required when creating
parameters.name: base

parameters.description: Upon creation of a dynamic environment, if this is true the template's chart releases will be copied to the new environment
parameters.name: chartReleasesFromTemplate

parameters.description: should be the environment branch for live envs. Is usually dev for template/dynamic but not necessarily
parameters.name: defaultFirecloudDevelopRef

parameters.description: When creating, will be calculated if left empty
parameters.name: defaultNamespace

parameters.description: When creating, will be calculated if dynamic, required otherwise
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Used for dynamic environment name generation only, to override using the owner email handle and template name
parameters.name: namePrefix

parameters.description: When creating, will be set to your email
parameters.name: owner

parameters.description: Used to protect specific BEEs from deletion (thelma checks this field)
parameters.name: preventDeletion

parameters.description: Required for dynamic environments
parameters.name: templateEnvironment

parameters.description: When creating, will be calculated if left empty
parameters.name: uniqueResourcePrefix

parameters.description: An optional limit to the number of entries returned
parameters.name: limit

post.description:
Create a new Environment entry. Note that some fields are immutable after creation; /edit lists mutable fields.
Creating a dynamic environment based on a template will also copy ChartReleases from the template.

parameters.description: The Environment to create
parameters.name: environment

get.description: Get an existing Environment entry via one of its "selectors": name, numeric ID, or "resource-prefix/" + the unique resource prefix.

parameters.description: The Environment to get's selector: name, numeric ID, or
parameters.name: selector

delete.description: Delete an existing Environment entry via one of its "selectors": name, numeric ID, or "resource-prefix/" + the unique resource prefix.

parameters.description: The Environment to delete's selector: name, numeric ID, or
parameters.name: selector

patch.description: Edit an existing Environment entry via one of its "selectors": name, numeric ID. Note that only mutable fields are available here, immutable fields can only be set using /create, or "resource-prefix/" + the unique resource prefix.

parameters.description: The Environment to edit's selector: name, numeric ID, or
parameters.name: selector

parameters.description: The edits to make to the Environment
parameters.name: environment

post.description:
Looks up and applies previously-planned version diffs given by the ID. Other stored plans against the same Chart Releases are marked as superseded.
Multiple Changesets can be specified simply by passing multiple IDs in the list.
post.summary: Apply previously planned version changes to Chart Releases

parameters.description: String IDs of the Changesets to apply
parameters.name: apply-request

post.description:
Refreshes and calculates version diffs for Chart Releases. If there's a diff, the plan is stored and returned so it can be applied later.
Multiple Chart Releases can be specified--as can groups of Chart Releases from multiple Environments.
post.summary: Plan--but do not apply--version changes to Chart Releases

parameters.description: Info on what version changes or refreshes to plan
parameters.name: changeset-plan-request

post.description: Like the plan and apply endpoints immediately in sequence.
post.summary: Plan and apply version changes in one step

parameters.description: Info on what version changes or refreshes to perform
parameters.name: changeset-plan-request

get.description: Get Sherlock's understanding of the calling user based on IAP and the Firecloud.org Google Workspace organization.
get.summary: Get information about the calling user

get.description:
Get Sherlock's current status. Right now, this endpoint always returned OK (if the server is online).
This endpoint is acceptable to use for a readiness check.
Get the build version of this Sherlock instance.
